data.title: Loved this place!
data.text: We only ate in the bar area for a quick lunch but it was like the entire list of food options and wine options was made for me!  The food selection was scrumptious and not at all over filling.  Wine selection was awesome.  I would be a regular if I lived in Santa Barbara!

data.title: Great location near tasting rooms
data.text: Conveniently located near several tasting rooms in the El Paseo complex.  Average food but local beers and wines on the menu....

data.title: Quiet time and great service
data.text: Great place to get a good glass of wine and steak bites after a crowded movie!  Enough folks to feel comfortable but not jammed... and conducive to quiet conversation (reviewing movie we just saw)---  affordable, happy atmosphere!

data.title: Delightful Anniversary Shared Plates
data.text: Burrata Jar to DIE for! Carnitas flatbread AMAZING! Spanish corn.....must must have to go along with flatbread. Everything we tried, we loved!

data.title: A Hidden Gem
data.text: I was invited to cocktails at Intermezzo the other night and after my visit, I wondered why I don't go there more often!  The atmosphere was such a refreshing change from the usual spots on State St., very sophisticated, yet not stuffy, quiet enough to have a conversation, but a great locals vibe, amazing service by Trevor and while we only had light snacks (cauliflower, calamari and steak bites) everything was delicious and there were many more things on the menu I look forward to trying.  Intermezzo will definitely be top of mind next time I am looking for a hip yet classy place to unwind.

data.title: Loved this place!
data.text: Had a reeeeeely nice lunch here after a small garden wedding at the Santa Barbara Courthouse. Party of about 14-15. They really accommodated us, printed up custom menus with couples' names, which was a super nice touch. We had "family style" apps, and the food, ordered off the menu, came out quickly. They were also able to provide a wedding cake that we were all so happy with. House wines and ability to order cocktails really added to the event. Had scoped this place out about a month ago with friends, and made everyone order something different so we could get a good overview of the food. The preview was great, food and cocktails really hit the mark; and yesterday's event was even better. Shout out to the server (who we had both times)! Didn't get your name, but wish you nothing but the best with the coming birth of the baby! Thank you to the whole staff! P.S. Sat on the patio, which was awesome! fountain and all - and thank goodness for good weather (although we did have a backup plan!)

data.title: Simply amazing!!
data.text: Wonderful place for dinner or just a glass of wine - the quality is superb!! Since the first visit it has become my favorite place in Santa Barbara when I meet friends or need a moment just for me :)

data.title: Wonderful Restaurant
data.text: The food and service never disappoint!  My husband and I always have a meal at Intermezzo when we are in Santa Barbara!

data.title: Great menu best place to eat before you go to a movie or show or concert ate the Santa barbara bowl
data.text: It has become our favorite place to meet friends  drink some Margerum Wine and share delicious small food dishes before going to an event. We go there at least every 4 to 6 weeks.

data.title: Don't tell anyone!
data.text: Don't tell anyone, please, that you enjoyed the delicious food or the wonderfully casual atmosphere complimented with the friendly service. It's already too crowded, it's already too popular. Like Yogi Berra said, "No one goes there anymore because it's too popular..." It feels like your surrounded by famous people in the comfort of their home. Oh, I guess you are.

data.title: Just what we wanted
data.text: Great burgers and the best creme brûlée I have had in ages. The decor is elegant yet not stuffy and you can enjoy a great meal and cocktail while keeping an eye on the football. Very friendly waiter and relaxed atmosphere.

data.title: best burger
data.text: Great wines and beers, casual ambiance, delicious food and "bite sized" portions to share, friendly staff

data.title: Excellent off State Street option
data.text: Excellent small plates, service, atmosphere and drink options. Full bar or excellent local wines, you pick. Lots of very interesting small plate options and everything we have tried are excellent. Service is high quality: friendly while being professional. Rib sliders and gazpacho are excellent choices but don't stop there.

data.title: Small Plates, Big Treat
data.text: We thoroughly enjoyed dining on the front portico at Intermezzo. Simple, imaginative, flavorful food is served with excellent wines. The wait staff was particularly friendly and attentive, which made for a relaxing and delightful experience. Intermezzo is a sister restaurant to Wine Cask.

data.title: OK but Not Great
data.text: We stopped by Intermezzo for a quick bite before attending the theater. It worked well for that purpose. Short menu with nice choices of wines and beers. Service was prompt and friendly. However, food was average. This is a good palce to go for a quick bite before the theater but not a go-to foodie place.

data.title: Everything was beautiful!
data.text: My boss and I met here for my employee review! We sat outside on a beautiful afternoon. Our waiter was very attentive and prompt. I had some love Qupe Chardonnay. Although Trevor was not our waiter, he came out from the bar to check on us a couple of times. My boss and I shared some fabulous calamari - probably the best in town. It was overall a wonderful, delightful experience.

data.title: Great place before or after Lobero or SB Bowl
data.text: Quick bites and great wine selection.  Easy in and out.  Good home town crowd.  I am there during the SB International Food Festival every day and never tire of it.

data.title: Incredible
data.text: We stumbled across this having found the place we were going to closed and it serves some of the best food we've had on our trip to California. If you want a local feel chilled out restaurant with good food and wine you need to go here. The crab and artichoke dip is amazing, the wagyu and Angus beef burger is unbelievably tasty and we had a delicious carafe of wine to go with it. Skip the apple tart if you're British or French - not what you'll be used to - bread and butter pudding however is a completely different story!

data.title: busy and nosey - local hangout
data.text: We just did some apps and wine for an early dinner. good thing we got there early as all the locals were circling the tables when we left.  Mac and cheese was good as was the Calimari.  Flat bread was OK.  Wine was good - served at the proper temp with many choices.

data.title: Lovely and elegant dining al fresco
data.text: Traveling with pups makes for an interesting time finding delicious food and a nice setting where your pups are welcome.  We found it all at Intermezzo, which is part of one of our favorite restaurants, The Wine Cask in downtown Santa Barbara   We had an early dinner, around 6 PM , and the weather was perfect ( duh, we are in Santa Barbara!) we sat out side and our pups sat at our feet.  The waiter brought them water and suggested some grilled chicken strips for them ( obviously spoiled pups) our dinner was delicious. We were looking for a light meal, and the menu did not disappoint.  Our sales were garden fresh, with just the right amount of dressing to lightly coat the green leafy butter lettuce, but not drown your taste buds.  We had Share -plates including a delicious flatbread with home made mozzarella and sweet, ripe tomatoes.  We ordered a bottle of one of our favorite Chardonnays, but instead of bringing us the bottle they brought the opened wine in a carafe. There was no,opening of the wine at your table, nor tasting of the wine before it was served. We didn't know that our bottle would be served that way.  We only ordered a bottle because we were on foot, and hoped to cork the bottle and take the remaining wine back to our hotel for a night cap.  For this reason, I took off a star.  Someone should have mentioned that fact because had we known, we would have only ordered the wine by the glass or half carafe. Next time we will keep that in mind, as our dinner was otherwise delightful, the ambience was pleasant, and we and our pups were quite full and satisfied when we left.

owner_response.author: Mitchell S, Owner at Intermezzo, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are delighted you and ‘your pups’ enjoyed dining on our Mediterranean Courtyard and are sorry there was confusion with your wine order.  We are thrilled and proud of our decision to ‘go green’ with our innovative wine tap system in Intermezzo, where all wines are served by the glass or carafe.  Our wonderful local wineries deliver tanks of wine, saving the waste of glass bottles, corks, cardboard boxes and even the paper labels!  Of course sitting outside it’s entirely possible you did not see this coming so next time we’ll be delighted to package any leftover wine for take-away—and thanks again for your warm review.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
